cards.title: The amazing world of sport / Does Firmino really score a 'no-look' basket with his foot?
cards.rawTitle: Does Firmino really score a 'no-look' basket with his foot?

item.title: Does Brazilian footballer Roberto Firmino really score a 'no-look' basket with his foot?
item.trailText: New Liverpool striker Roberto Firmino appears to kick a football into a basketball hoop without looking
item.standFirst: New Liverpool striker Roberto Firmino appears to kick a football into a basketball hoop without looking. Firmino, known for his 'no-look' goals in the Bundesliga and Brazil, appears to repeat the trick on a basketball court. But is it real, what do you think? Liverpool confirmed on Wednesday they have signed the 23-year-old forward on a five-year deal for a fee of around £29m

cards.title: Rugby union / Lancaster: England will wait for Cipriani
cards.rawTitle: Lancaster: England will wait for Cipriani

item.title: England will wait for Danny Cipriani, says Stuart Lancaster
item.trailText: England's rugby union coach, Stuart Lancaster, says he is waiting to read the police report on fly-half Danny Cipriani before deciding whether to include him in the England world cup squad
item.standFirst: England's rugby union coach, Stuart Lancaster, says he is waiting to read the police report on fly-half Danny Cipriani before deciding whether to include him in the England world cup squad. Cipriani was was arrested for drink-driving earlier this month and police will finish the report in early August.

cards.title: Baseball / Cubs fan catches ball while holding baby
cards.rawTitle: Cubs fan catches ball while holding baby

item.title: Cubs fan catches baseball with bare hand while holding baby
item.trailText: A Cubs fan who was bottle-feeding a baby makes a casual barehanded catch during a game at Wrigley Field on Tuesday night
item.standFirst: A Chicago Cubs fan who was bottle-feeding a baby makes a casual barehanded catch during a game at Wrigley Field on Tuesday night. Keith Hartley takes the ball over the glove of Dodgers first baseman Adrian Gonzalez, who immediately complains about interference. Hartley later said he caught the ball to 'protect' his child

cards.title: Golf / Three-metre sink hole has opened on course in Kansas
cards.rawTitle: Three-metre sink hole has opened on course in Kansas

item.title: Sinkhole opens on Kansas golf course
item.trailText: A three-metre sink hole has opened in a golf course in Kansas
item.standFirst: A three-metre sink hole has opened in a golf course in Kansas. Officials at the Canyon Farms golf course in Lenexa said the hazard appeared on the fairway of the 13th hole last Friday after heavy rain. Much of the course is built on top of a disused limestone mine prompting officials to check for further weak spots

cards.title: In pictures / All the best images from the last 16 at the Women's World Cup
cards.rawTitle: All the best images from the last 16 at the Women's World Cup

item.title: Women's World Cup 2015: the last 16
item.trailText: We round up the best photos from the first knockout stage of the Women’s World Cup in Canada

Sasic did have better luck elsewhere, however, scoring from the spot in the first half and heading home from close range in the 78th minute, as a dominant Germany won 4-1 Photograph: Dennis Grombkowski/Bongarts/Getty Images

cards.title: Football / Uruguay's Cavani may miss Copa América Chile clash
cards.rawTitle: Uruguay's Cavani may miss Copa América Chile clash

item.title: Uruguay's Edinson Cavani may miss Copa América Chile clash
item.trailText: Speaking on Tuesday Óscar Tabárez, the Uruguay coach, says his striker, Edinson Cavani, may miss the Chile match on Wednesday due to a family incident
item.standFirst: Speaking on Tuesday Óscar Tabárez, the Uruguay coach, says his striker, Edinson Cavani, may miss the Chile match on Wednesday due to a family incident. On Monday Cavani's father was involved in a fatal car crash in which a 19-year-old motorcyclist was killed. The striker has not yet said whether he will return to the squad

stillImage.caption: 620x372 trailpic for Uruguay striker Edinson Cavani may miss Copa America Chile clash - video Photograph: guardian.co.uk

cards.title: Paragliding / Paraglider flies into moving cable car ... on purpose
cards.rawTitle: Paraglider flies into moving cable car ... on purpose

item.title: Paraglider flies into moving cable car ... on purpose
item.trailText: Arnaud Longobardi, 43, flies into the open doors of a moving cable car, 150 metres above the ground, in the French Alps
item.standFirst:
Arnaud Longobardi, 43, flies into the open doors of a moving cable car, 150 metres above the ground, in the French Alps. For the stunt to work, Longobardi has to perfectly time his takeoff after the cable car leaves its dock, in order to enter its door at the precise point necessary - when it is briefly travelling horizontally rather than at an angle up or down - according to organisers

• Watch the full video here

displayImages.caption: 620x372 trailpic for Paraglider Photograph: guardian.co.uk

displayImages.cleanCaption: 620x372 trailpic for Paraglider
